newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico forms committee to smooth natgas prices.
newsitem.headline: Mexico forms committee to smooth natgas prices.

text.p: The Mexican Natural Gas Association said Wednesday it had created a "Prices and Tariffs Committee" to try and smooth out seasonal price fluctuations.

Natural gas distributors within the association were looking to protect consumers against violent fluctuations in natural gas prices, the association said. Natural gas prices hit a five-year high of $3.73 per million British Thermal Units (BTUs) in December.

The statement did not say how it would smooth out price fluctuations but said it was looking at technical norms and management methods and was in touch with official organizations such as the government Energy Regulatory Commission.

Under current regulations, it said, "the natural gas supplier will charge the distributor the cost of the raw material (natural gas), the storage and gas transport services. The distributor only adds the costs passed on by the supplier, plus that of the distribution service," it said.
The association includes 38 natural gas companies, both domestic and international.

Mexico is setting up a natural gas distribution network by adjudicating transportation, distribution and storage concessions to private business as part of a program to liberalize the natural gas sector.
The sector was formerly monopolized by state oil and gas firm Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex), which retains its hold on natural gas production in Mexico.
The liberalization program also allows the import of natural gas from abroad.
